metadata.Title: CVE-2012-6702 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Expat, when used in a parser that has not called XML_SetHashSalt or passed it a seed of 0, makes it easier for context-dependent attackers to defeat cryptographic protection mechanisms via vectors involving use of the srand function.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6702` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.2
lib64expat1 - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.2
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> tla uses system expat as of 1.3.5+dfsg-15 rodrigo-zaiden> related to CVE-2012-0876, where the fix added XML_SetHashSalt and generate_hash_secret_salt methods. libxmltok does not have those methods, hence not affected. ccdm94> cmake 3.20.5 and forward uses expat 2.2.10+.

criterions.comment: expat package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.2').
insighttoolkit: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
libxmltok: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
tla package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
vnc4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
xmlrpc-c: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
